properties.Title: Severe Thunderstorm Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: At 19:29 PM EST, a line of severe thunderstorm over Lake Ontario is moving eastwards at speed of 50 km/h. These thunderstorms are capable of producing very strong wind gusts up to 90 km/h, up to dime size hail and heavy rain. ### Heavy downpours can cause flash floods and water pooling on roads. Strong wind gusts can toss loose objects, damage weak buildings, break branches off trees and overturn large vehicles. Severe thunderstorm warnings are issued when imminent or occurring thunderstorms are likely to produce or are producing one or more of the following: large hail, damaging winds, torrential rainfall.
Expires: 2020-03-29T22:32:11-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-03-29T19:34:11-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.2897344752.2020
Area: Napanee - Consecon, Picton - Sandbanks Park
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Special Weather Statement In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Heavy rainfall expected today. Rain, heavy at times, and isolated thunderstorms will continue to move eastward today. Total rainfall amounts could exceed 25 mm in very localized areas that receive multiple rounds of heavy rain in thunderstorms. There is considerable uncertainty regarding where the highest rainfall amounts will occur. Rainfall Warnings with the criteria of 25 mm within 24 hours where the ground remains frozen may be required. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ONStorm.
Expires: 2020-03-30T05:08:56-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-03-29T13:09:56-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.1366578290.2020
Area: Searchmont - Montreal River Harbour - Batchawana Bay, Sault Ste. Marie - St. Joseph Island, Greater Sudbury and vicinity, Elliot Lake - Ranger Lake, West Nipissing - French River, North Bay - Powassan - Mattawa, Blind River - Thessalon, Espanola - Killarney, Manitoulin Island
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Severe Thunderstorm Watch In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Conditions are favourable for the development of severe thunderstorms that may be capable of producing strong wind gusts and large hail. ### Large hail can damage property and cause injury. Strong wind gusts can toss loose objects, damage weak buildings, break branches off trees and overturn large vehicles. Locally heavy rain is also possible. Severe thunderstorm watches are issued when atmospheric conditions are favourable for the development of thunderstorms that could produce one or more of the following: large hail, damaging winds, torrential rainfall. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ONStorm. For more information: http://www.emergencymanagementontario.ca/english/beprepared/beprepared.html.
Expires: 2020-03-30T00:30:56-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-03-29T18:31:56-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.3031584767.2020
Area: Mount Forest - Arthur - Northern Wellington County, Guelph - Erin - Southern Wellington County, Innisfil - New Tecumseth - Angus, Shelburne - Mansfield - Northern Dufferin County, Orangeville - Grand Valley - Southern Dufferin County, Caledon
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Squall Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Squalls with wind gusts up to 45 knots are expected this afternoon. Radar images show a line of thunderstorms over eastern Lake Erie is moving northeastward at 70 km/h. This line is expected to reach west end of Lake Ontario in the next half hour. These thunderstorms are capable to produce wind gusts up to 45 knots. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. For more information monitor Canadian Coast Guard radio or Weatheradio stations.
Expires: 2020-03-29T21:35:42-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-03-29T17:36:42-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.0668988255.2020
Area: Eastern Lake Erie, Western Lake Ontario
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Wind Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: There will be southerly winds gusting to 110 kilometres per hour over this community until this evening. ### Wind warnings are issued when there is a significant risk of damaging winds. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to QCstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #QCStorm.
Expires: 2020-03-30T02:59:05-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-03-29T19:14:05-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.3282188200.2020
Area: Salluit
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Snowfall Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: A Pacific storm will continue to give snowfalll over the highway passes with 15 to 25 cm of snow expected for Rogers Pass and Kootenay Pass by Monday morning. The Coquihalla Hope to Merritt segment may see up to 15 cm by this evening. As the cold front sweeps across the province today, an unsettled airmass will result in brief but intense bursts of flurries over the highways with possible sudden reduction in visibility due to heavy snow. Be aware of sudden changes in road conditions and visibility, particularly near the highway summits. ### Visibility may be suddenly reduced at times in heavy snow. Weather in the mountains can change suddenly resulting in hazardous driving conditions. Road conditions are available at www.drivebc.ca. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to BCstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #BCStorm.
Expires: 2020-03-30T09:28:29-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-03-29T17:29:29-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.2300269145.2020
Area: Highway 3 - Paulson Summit to Kootenay Pass, Coquihalla Highway - Hope to Merritt, Trans-Canada Highway - Eagle Pass to Rogers Pass
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Blizzard Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Blizzard conditions are occurring over these localities. The conditions will improve this evening. ### Blizzard warnings are issued when widespread reduced visibilities of 400 metres or less are expected for at least 4 hours. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to QCstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #QCStorm.
Expires: 2020-03-30T04:59:38-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-03-29T19:13:38-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.2174646592.2020

properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Snowfall Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: A prolonged period of snowfall will impact communities in northern Manitoba beginning this evening and intensifying Monday. Snow will be heavy at times and will accumulate quickly. Beginning overnight on Monday, snow will gradually begin to taper off from west to east. Storm total amounts will be in the 15 to 25 cm range with localized areas possibly receiving more. This storm system is still developing, and warnings may be modified or other regions may be added. Stay alert for updated forecasts. ### Visibility may be suddenly reduced at times in heavy snow. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to MBstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #MBStorm.
Expires: 2020-03-30T12:37:12-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-03-29T20:38:12-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.2229192893.2020
Area: Brochet, Tadoule Lake, Lynn Lake, Leaf Rapids, Pukatawagan, Churchill

properties.Title: Rainfall Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Heavy rain today. Rain, heavy at times, will continue through most of the day. Embedded thunderstorms are likely to accompany the rain at times. Total rainfall amounts of 25 to 40 mm are likely, with the highest amounts expected where thunderstorms occur. The ground in the area remains partially frozen. Since frozen ground has a reduced ability to absorb rainfall, winter criteria thresholds of 25 mm with 24 hours is being used for this Rainfall Warning. ### Localized flooding in low-lying areas is possible. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ONStorm.
Expires: 2020-03-30T09:00:30-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-03-29T17:40:30-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.4037070817.2020

properties.Title: Blizzard Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Blizzard ending midday. Poor visibilities in blowing snow are ongoing in the wake of a low pressure system now moving through Hudson Bay. Winds gusting to 70 km/h and blizzard conditions will continue this morning before easing near midday. ### Travel is expected to be extremely hazardous due to reduced visibility. Blizzard warnings are issued when widespread reduced visibilities of 400 metres or less are expected for at least 6 hours. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NUstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NUStorm.
Expires: 2020-03-29T20:59:38-00:00

properties.Summary:
Description: Heavy wet snow expected tonight through Monday morning. Snow mixed with rain this afternoon will change over to snow tonight then gradually tapering off on Monday morning. Be prepared to adjust your driving with changing road conditions. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. properties.Title: Emergency Advisory Alert Issued By Ministry Of Health
properties.Summary:
Description: This is an update for the Emergency Advisory Alert issued by the Ministry of Health. If you or somebody you know attended the Christopher Lake snowmobile rally and supper on Saturday, March 14, you are advised to contact 811 as soon as possible. If you are experiencing signs of fever, coughing, or breathing issues, call 811 immediately.
Expires: 2020-03-31T17:00:00-06:00

properties.Title: Wind Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Strong wind gusts of 90 km/h expected late this afternoon. Very strong southwesterly wind gusts of 90 km/h ahead of a cold front are reported over Windsor and Chatham region this afternoon. The strong winds are expected to move eastwards and affect other regions over southwestern Ontario later this afternoon and early this evening. The strong wind gusts will taper off this evening. ### Damage to buildings, such as to roof shingles and windows, may occur. High winds may toss loose objects or cause tree branches to break. Wind warnings are issued when there is a significant risk of damaging winds. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ONStorm.
Expires: 2020-03-30T01:11:46-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-03-29T19:23:46-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.1480433751.2020

properties.Summary:
Description: Rain, at times heavy, is expected. Rainfall amounts of 25 to 50 millimetres are expected over these areas through Monday. A low pressure system from the United States will affect the province of Quebec and spread rain over the southwest of the province. ### Localized flooding in low-lying areas is possible. Rainfall warnings are issued when significant rainfall is expected. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. properties.Title: Freezing Rain Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Freezing rain is expected or occurring. Locations: Northern Avalon Peninsula. Time span: until this afternoon. Remarks: Freezing rain mixed with ice pellets is expected to taper to freezing drizzle and flurries later this afternoon. ### Surfaces such as highways, roads, walkways and parking lots may become icy and slippery. Freezing rain warnings are issued when rain falling in sub-zero temperatures creates ice build-up and icy surfaces. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NLstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NLwx.
Expires: 2020-03-29T22:59:07-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-03-29T17:23:07-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.2768059184.2020
Area: Avalon Peninsula North, St. John's and vicinity
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Freezing Drizzle Advisory In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Areas of freezing drizzle are expected or occurring. Locations: Northern Avalon Peninsula, including St. John's and vicinity. Time span: continuing until Monday afternoon. Remarks: Freezing drizzle, occasionally mixed with flurries, will continue until temperatures gradually rise above zero on Monday afternoon ### Surfaces such as highways, roads, walkways and parking lots may become icy and slippery. Freezing drizzle advisories are issued when drizzle falling in sub-zero temperatures is expected to freeze on contact, and over time create icy surfaces. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NLstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NLwx.
Expires: 2020-03-30T10:25:24-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-03-29T18:26:24-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.1504871453.2020
Area: Avalon Peninsula North, St. John's and vicinity
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Special Weather Statement In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: A low pressure system from United States will continue to affect the province of Quebec until Monday. Snowfall amounts of up to 15 centimetres are possible for Central Quebec. However, precipitation amounts could vary widely depending on the region as temperatures will be near the freezing mark. Some areas near and south of the St. Lawrence River could primarily see 5 to 10 centimetres of snow, while up to 15 centimetres may fall locally over higher terrain. Rapidly accumulating snow could make travel difficult locally. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to QCstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #QCStorm.
Expires: 2020-03-30T12:13:18-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-03-29T20:14:18-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.4125314597.2020
